criteria: Identification and Description of Physical Features
Identification and Description of Human Geographic Features
Understanding of the Interrelationship Between Physical and Human Features
descriptions: Student does not identify or incorrectly identifies physical features of California. Description is missing or inaccurate.
Student identifies a few physical features of California but provides minimal or vague descriptions.
Student identifies some physical features of California and provides basic descriptions, but lacks detail or accuracy in places.
Student accurately identifies most physical features of California and provides clear and reasonably detailed descriptions.
Student accurately identifies physical features of California and provides detailed and insightful descriptions, demonstrating good understanding.
Student comprehensively identifies and describes physical features of California with exceptional detail, accuracy, and insightful analysis.
Student does not identify or incorrectly identifies human geographic features of California. Description is missing or inaccurate.
Student identifies a few human geographic features of California but provides minimal or vague descriptions.
Student identifies some human geographic features of California and provides basic descriptions, but lacks detail or accuracy in places.
Student accurately identifies most human geographic features of California and provides clear and reasonably detailed descriptions.
Student accurately identifies human geographic features of California and provides detailed and insightful descriptions, demonstrating good understanding.
Student comprehensively identifies and describes human geographic features of California with exceptional detail, accuracy, and insightful analysis.
Student fails to demonstrate any understanding of how physical and human geographic features interact or influence each other in California.
Student shows a very limited or superficial understanding of the relationship between physical and human features.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of how physical and human geographic features may be related, but lacks depth or specific examples.
Student demonstrates a clear understanding of the interrelationship between physical and human geographic features in shaping California's places and regions, providing relevant examples.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of the complex interrelationship between physical and human features, offering insightful analysis and well-supported examples.
Student demonstrates an exceptional understanding of the intricate connections between physical and human features, providing comprehensive analysis and demonstrating a nuanced perspective.
